Bad Bevensen lies in a gently-rolling landscape on the North German Plain. The region is characterized by potato, sugar beet and grain farming, by forests, small heaths, the valley of the Ilmenau and the Elbe Lateral Canal.

The River Ilmenau flows through the town and the Elbe Lateral Canal runs past it to the east.

The town was first mentioned in the records in 1162, but was not given town rights until 1929. It has been officially recognised by the state as a mineral health spa since 1976. There are up to 6 large rehabilitation clinics around Bad Bevensen and many of the town's facilities and businesses are geared up to catering for rehabilitation patients. This tends to give the town a slow, relaxing pace of life.
Bad Bevensen is  85 km southeast of Hamburg on the B4 federal road.  It is between the towns of Uelzen and Lüneburg which can be accessed from the A7 autobahn.
There are hourly connections from the Bad Bevensen station both north to Hamburg and south, via

Once in Bad Bevensen most facilities and hotels are accessible by foot.  However for the less able, a good taxi service is available. Most of the main hotels are east of the River Ilmenau and restaurants to the west.

The 17th century monastic farm estate known as Klosterhof Medingen (Medingen Monastery Estate) where, 50 years ago, a Trakehner stud was established. Mauritius Klosterweg 1, 29549 Bad Bevensen, 0.7 miles from town centre Tel: +495821 2286

(Deutsches Salzmuseum)  Lüneburg is famous for salt. It was built on a huge salt field. The German Salt Museum was opened on the site of the mines here. Sulfmeisterstrasse 1, D-21335 Luneburg,13.1 miles from town centre Tel: +49413145065

This modern spa focuses on the needs of people who wish to do something for their health and to keep fit in a quiet landscape with beautiful forests. Dahlenburger Str. 1, 29549 Bad Bevensen, 0.7 miles from town centre
A museum demonstrating a blast from the past with agriculture / farming done the old fashioned way., Landtagsplatz 2, 29556 Suderburg, 17.9 miles from town centre
The spa town is in the middle of the Lüneburg Heath and as such most of the souvenirs are heath related (prints and local arts and crafts).

value: content=The Heinz Eggert distillery produces a wide range of local liquours and spirits in their Hermann Löns range, named after the famous heath poet, such as
("Old Heath Hunter") based on herbs and wild fruit.

Most of the hotels and restaurants have bar facilities.
